page.title: 03Outdoor Recreation in Alton
page.content: I go to the Public Gardens as often as I can. There are a roundabout, seesaws and swings and a mound with trees and bushes on it. There are some flower beds, a bandstand and some stone seats with sheltering trees, where old people come for some peace. There are some statues in the Gardens and a bowling green. Flood Meadows is a large area of grassland with some trees and the River Wey running through.In the morning many people come to walk their dogs there. There is a play area with a slide and climbing frame. In the spring you can find frogspawn. You can also see toads, lizards and ducks. Kings Pond, to the east of town, has swans and ducks which I feed when I go for a ride there. I have a tree camp and we play football on the grass.
